intro: Liliastrum liliastrum, commonly known as the white lily-of-the-valley, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped white flowers and grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, green berries that contain the seeds, which are dispersed by birds. Liliastrum liliastrum thrives in moist, woodland environments and is often found in shaded areas with well-drained soil. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within its native range.
